# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_box(
    items: Annotated[list[Item], Len(5, 5)],
    assignments: Annotated[list[BoxAssignment], Len(5, 5)],
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item : Item = items[i]
        assignment : BoxAssignment = assignments[i]
        assert assignment.x + item.width <= box_width
        assert assignment.y + item.height <= box_height
        assert assignment.x >= 0
        assert assignment.y >= 0

fit_items_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- constraints ---
def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: Annotated[list[Item], Len(5, 5)],
    assignments: Annotated[list[BoxAssignment], Len(5, 5)]
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Check if items are in the same box
            assert assignments[i].box_id != assignments[j].box_id or \
                   (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x or assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x) or \
                   (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y or assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_in_one_box(
    assignments: Annotated[list[BoxAssignment], Len(5, 5)]
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1

ensure_item_in_one_box(item_box_assignments)

nr_used_boxes = objective
partial_formulation_up_until_now:
Item = DSRecord({
    "value": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "weight": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=1000),
    "x": DSFloat(lb=0, ub=10000),
    "y": DSFloat(lb=0, ub=10000)
})

Item = DSRecord({"width" : DSInt(lb=1, ub=5), "height" : DSInt(lb=1, ub=6)})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT : int = 6
BOX_WIDTH : int = 19
ITEMS : DSList(length=5, elem_type=Item) = [{'width': 3, 'height': 1}, {'width': 4, 'height': 2}, {'width': 4, 'height': 2}, {'width': 2, 'height': 4}, {'width': 5, 'height': 6}]
N_ITEMS : int = 5
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=1, ub=1000)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=5, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
x_y_positions : DSList(length=5, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 5
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 5


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=5, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> int:
    max_box_id = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id = assignments[i].box_id
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

calculated_objective_value = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
objective = calculated_objective_value

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_box(
    items: DSList(length=5, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=5, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item : Item = items[i]
        assignment : BoxAssignment = assignments[i]
        assert assignment.x + item.width <= box_width
        assert assignment.y + item.height <= box_height
        assert assignment.x >= 0
        assert assignment.y >= 0

fit_items_in_box(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# --- constraints ---
def prevent_item_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=5, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=5, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Check if items are in the same box
            assert assignments[i].box_id != assignments[j].box_id or \
                   (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x or assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x) or \
                   (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y or assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_in_one_box(
    assignments: DSList(length=5, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1

ensure_item_in_one_box(item_box_assignments)

nr_used_boxes = objective
